sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: What is the volume of a sphere with a radius of 7 cm? Round your answer to the nearest tenth of a cubic centimeter.
message_2:
The formula for the volume of a sphere is V = (4/3)πr³, where V is the volume and r is the radius.

Given a radius of 7 cm, we can plug this value into the formula:

V = (4/3)π(7³)
V = (4/3)π(343)
V ≈ 1436.8 cubic centimeters

So, the volume of the sphere is approximately 1436.8 cubic centimeters, rounded to the nearest tenth.
